message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. I'm willing to give you a 20% discount on this one-time offer. This is a rare opportunity to get a high-quality product at a discounted price.
Thanks for the discount! I'll take it.
I'm offering you a product that I'm confident you'll love. It's a game-changer, and I'm willing to sell it to you for the same price as the last one, $10000. Trust me, you won't regret it!
I'm not sure I trust your judgement anymore.  Can you tell me if this product is high-quality or low-quality?

I understand your concerns from the previous round, but I assure you that this product is indeed high-quality. In fact, I'll give you an additional guarantee: if you buy this product and it's not worth at least $12500 to you, I'll give you a full refund. This is a one-time offer, and I'm confident you'll be happy with your purchase.
Okay, I'm willing to take a chance on your guarantee. I'll buy it.

I'm still willing to sell it to you for $10000, but I want to be transparent with you. This product is not worth as much to me as the previous one, and I'm essentially taking a loss on this sale. I'm doing this because I value our relationship and want to make sure you're happy with your purchases.
I appreciate your transparency, but I'm going to pass on this one.  You're essentially telling me it's a low-quality product, and I'm not willing to risk another $10000 on that.
